intro: Ruschia gemina, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of star-shaped, pale blue or purple flowers. It is well adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its low-growing habit and drought tolerance make it an excellent addition to xeriscaped landscapes.
